criteria.description: Factual correctness of the output relative to the source material.

anchors.score_1: Contains multiple factual errors or fabricated information not present in source.
anchors.score_3: Mostly accurate with minor inaccuracies that do not alter the core message.
anchors.score_5: Completely accurate; every claim is verifiable from the source material.

criteria.description: Coverage of key points and information from the source material.

anchors.score_1: Omits most key points; fails to address the instruction adequately.
anchors.score_3: Covers the main points but misses some secondary details.
anchors.score_5: Thoroughly covers all key points and relevant details as required by the instruction.

criteria.description: Degree to which the output addresses the instruction and stays on topic.

anchors.score_1: Largely off-topic or includes substantial irrelevant content.
anchors.score_3: Mostly relevant with occasional tangential content.
anchors.score_5: Entirely relevant; every sentence directly serves the instruction.

criteria.description: Logical flow, structure, and internal consistency of the output.

anchors.score_1: Disorganized, contradictory, or difficult to follow.
anchors.score_3: Generally logical but with some structural weaknesses or minor inconsistencies.
anchors.score_5: Excellently organized with clear logical progression and no contradictions.

criteria.description: Information density and absence of unnecessary verbosity. Rewards brevity that retains meaning.

anchors.score_1: Extremely verbose; padded with redundant phrases, filler, or unnecessary repetition. Low information density.
anchors.score_3: Acceptable length but could be tighter; some redundancy present.
anchors.score_5: Maximally concise; every word carries meaning. High information density with no filler.

criteria.description: Ease of understanding and quality of language use.

anchors.score_1: Ambiguous, jargon-heavy, or poorly worded; difficult to understand.
anchors.score_3: Understandable but could benefit from clearer expression.
anchors.score_5: Crystal clear; uses precise language that is immediately understandable.

criteria.description: Quality of logical reasoning, analysis, and argumentation.

anchors.score_1: No reasoning shown; conclusions stated without support.
anchors.score_3: Basic reasoning present but may lack depth or contain logical gaps.
anchors.score_5: Strong, well-supported reasoning with clear cause-effect chains and evidence.

criteria.description: Absence of harmful, biased, or inappropriate content.

anchors.score_1: Contains harmful, biased, or inappropriate content.
anchors.score_3: Generally safe but may contain mildly insensitive language.
anchors.score_5: Completely safe, unbiased, and appropriate for all audiences.

criteria.description: Adherence to any specified output format requirements.

anchors.score_3: Partially follows format with some deviations.

criteria.description: Quality and accuracy of citations or references when applicable.

anchors.score_1: No citations provided or all citations are incorrect.
anchors.score_3: Some citations present but incomplete or inconsistently formatted.
anchors.score_5: All claims properly cited with accurate, well-formatted references.

criteria.description: Degree to which the output provides actionable insights or recommendations.

anchors.score_1: No actionable content; purely descriptive without guidance.
anchors.score_3: Some actionable suggestions but lacking specificity.
anchors.score_5: Highly actionable with specific, implementable recommendations.
